fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37690].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The issue navigator leaks memory in the client-side when browsing through the issue results in an issue search. This happens in both list view and details view, and has been tested in google chrome

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Google Chrome.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Execute a JQL Query with a significant number of total results (for example, 1000).
# Open Developer Tools --> Timeline - Check memory and Start Recording.
# Start browsing through the issues in the list (use j/k in list view / using the up-down arrows should be enough in details view).
# After you have done this for a number of issues (for example, 20), stop recording in the Timeline.
# *BUG* Notice the graph on memory consumption and how it keeps creeping up without memory being reclaimed.

h3. Expected Results

Memory usage does not keep increasing as you browse through issues. The allocated memory used when you go from one issue to another is reclaimed.

h3. Actual Results
Memory usage keeps increasing as you browse through all the issues in your results potentially leading to slugginess in the client.

h3.Workaround

Close the tab / Chrome and navigate to the page again in a new tab.

h3. Original Description

{quote}When leaving JIRA open in Chrome for an extended period of time, Chrome will eventually grow to consume a large percentage of the RAM on my machine. As much as 50% of available RAM will be set for that process in Chrome (not the only chrome process).

Ending this chrome task will close out only JIRA tabs, indicating that JIRA is causing the memory leak.
{quote}
fields.summary: Issue navigator leaks memory in the client-side whilst browsing through the issue results

fields.description:
h5. Overview

Confirmed that there are 2 missing files in the {{JIRA Installation Directory\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\jira\servlet}} for *JIRA 6.2.1* which are:
* {{BrowseProjectUrlHelper.class}}
* {{QuickLinkServlet.class}}

!missing_class.JPG|thumbnail!

Confirmed on the missing {{quicklink}} tags as per the following:
{code}
<servlet>
<servlet-name>quicklink</servlet-name>
<servlet-class>com.atlassian.jira.servlet.QuickLinkServlet</servlet-class>
</servlet>
{code}

AND 

{code}
<servlet-mapping>
<servlet-name>quicklink</servlet-name>
<url-pattern>/browse/*</url-pattern>
</servlet-mapping>
{code}

in {{JIRA Installation Directory\atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\web.xml}}. Please refer to the attachments to the {{web.xml}} for confirmation.

Is there any particular reason why the classes were dropped and the tags were not included?

h5. Workaround
Copy the missing classes to the directory and the tags to the new {{web.xml}}.

fields.description:
This issue was discovered while running on Tomcat 8. While earlier Tomcat versions may hide the issue (I haven't checked) my investigations into this issue haven't found anything that would suggest it is Tomcat 8 specific.

When making a request to Jira, multiple instances of the attached stack trace are observed.

A little debugging and looking at the Jira source code identified the source of the problem as the relative URLs used in /ui-aui-layout/icons.less. These relative URLs are all of the form "../../../images/..."

There are two problems.
The first is that all those URLs should start "../../images/..." to correctly locate the required image relative to the icons.less file.
The second issue is that to "resolve" this relative URL, the LessTransformer simply prepends "/" and then uses that value with ServletContext/getResource(). This is guaranteed to fail as any such lookup is relative to the context root.

I am currently running with a local modification to icons.less that replaces all instances of "../../../images/..." with "/images/..." which works around this issue.

I know Tomcat 8 is not a supported platform yet but I wanted to provide you with a heads up of this particular issue. Also, it looks like this will affect earlier Tomcat versions as well.

To date, the ASF has found running Jira on Tomcat 8 a fairly smooth process. There have only been two issues to date and while each took a little time to fully understand, both have been fairly simple to work-around.
fields.summary: LessTransformer incorrectly handles relative resources

fields.description:
If you try to edit an Agile board filter it will open the filter on edit mode and after you modify the JQL body you do not see the "Save" option, only the "Save As" button.

In order to be allowed to Save you need to press enter (perform a search first). As a side effect of performing the search, the "Save as" button will be transformed to "Save".

This weird behavior is counter-intuitive and I got at least 10 questions / support requests from users complaining that filter-editing-is-not-working. 

In fact the cause of this is only the bad-design of the filter edit. Please fix this as it is affecting real-life usage for most users.
fields.summary: Filter edit Save and Save As buttons are misleading

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37665].
  {panel}

As an administrator of a JIRA system, I would like to be able to provide a custom field type similar to the existing "Select List (cascading)" but for which it is possible for the user to select multiple values.

The "Select List (cascading)" field's description is "Choose multiple values from two select lists", so I was surprised to find that it is only possible to select one (pair) value.

I expected that it would behave in a similar manner to "Select List (multiple choice)" (given that the description is: "Choose multiple values in a select list"), with it being possible to re-use the paired-select-lists multiple times on a given issue, selecting and removing options (or rather option pairs) 

E.g. Favourite Soccer Teams:
[Leagues][v] > [Teams][v]
Selected:
- English Premier League > Arsenal (x)
- English Premier League > Liverpool (x)
- Spanish La Liga > Real Madrid (x)

The user experience when viewing and removing could, for instance, have been similar to the 'Labels' custom field.

It seems this is not currently supported, so I would like to request this feature.
fields.summary: Multiple selections in Cascading Select List

After installing the latest firmware update for Windows, there was an unexpected crash when using the taskbar. 

1.)  Install the latest firmware update for Windows
2.)  Manually reset the CPU after update
3.)  Boot up the CPU after initial shut off time
4.)  Using the mouse, navigate to the taskbar on the lower left-hand side

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37655].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms

Creating a new issue out of Admin mode pops up a Create Issue window, where unfilled required fields will be notified:
!createpopup.png|thumbnail!

The point is, other field values will be remained if already filled, including Epic Link, Sprint, and Linked Issues:
!createremain.png|thumbnail!

Creating a new issue from Admin mode (e.g. from Administration -> Issues) will not pop up a Create Issue window, instead the process will go through 2 phases:
!createadmin.png|thumbnail!

!createerror.png|thumbnail!

The point is, if required fields are unfilled (and the page refreshes), then specific fields will lose their filled value or even go missing. In the following screenshot, Epic Link, Sprint, and Linked Issues are losing their filled value (automatically cleared) while Remaining Estimate is missing:
!createcleared.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workarounds
* Make sure required fields are filled before clicking on Create to create a new issue
* Use the Create Issue pop-up window out of Admin mode
fields.summary: Field values automatically cleared due to unfilled required fields when creating issues from Admin mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37649].
  {panel}

The use of Roles at a project level is quite useful as a project administrator can set the values there, without the need to ask a system administrator to define groups.

For this reason, it would be nice to see the inclusion of Roles e.g. 
a Role = union of {users, groups, Roles}.

On a recent project with about a 100 users the project administrator, set up roles to represent the different interest groups.  We were then forced with 2 options: 
[1] change the notification scheme to include all the Role types or
[2] repeat all the users in each of the different Roles into the [user] role which was used in the notification scheme. e.g. we wanted the User role to be the union of all the Roles in the project.
fields.summary: Roles be the union of users, groups and/or roles

h3.Workaround
We have three options to work around this problem:
h4.Option 1: Set the new license before doing the upgrade
# Rollback JIRA to the older version using the [Rolling Back a JIRA Upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Rolling+Back+a+JIRA+Upgrade] guide.
# Update JIRA with the renewed license, which you can download from [my.atlassian.com|https://my.atlassian.com].
# Perform the upgrade.

h4.Option 2: Update license directly via database queries
# Update the license by executing the following query, replacing _PutLicenseHere_ with the actual license:
*PostgreSQL*
{code:SQL}
update propertytext 
set propertyvalue = 'PutLicenseHere' 
where ID = (SELECT pt.id FROM propertytext pt JOIN propertyentry pe ON pt.id = pe.id WHERE property_key = 'License20');
{code}
*MySQL*
Due to the [MySQL restriction that you cannot update a table and select from the same table in a subquery|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.1/en/update.html]:
## Run the query:
{code:sql}
UPDATE propertytext p
JOIN propertyentry pe ON p.id = pe.id and pe.property_key = 'License20'
SET p.propertyvalue = 'PutLicenseHere';
{code}
# Restart JIRA server

h4.Option 3 - Change setenv.sh/bat to include the upgrade option.
# Insert the following line as per our [Setting JIRA options| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+Properties+and+Options+on+Startup] document
{code}
-Dnon.admin.upgrade=true
{code}
# Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Can't update expired license after upgrading JIRA

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37643].
  {panel}

We don't allow users to modify notification schemes themselves. It requires system admin access.  Users will go to their project configuration screens and see the Notifications section and then see "Email: <email address>" and think they need to email that email address to ask for changes.  In reality, that's the email address sending the notifications configured in the screen.  

Can there be wording added to that screen to make it clear?  For example:

"Notifications configured in this screen will be sent by: <email address>".

Thanks!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37629].
  {panel}

This is not likely limited to JIRA.  However, there is no Atlassian SDK project in which users have permission to open tickets.

When developing plugins using the SDK, if the standalone server is started using '--server localhost', the service should bind to localhost.  It should not be accessible from the network.  Regardless of how secure you feel Atlassian's products may be, this is a security risk when developing custom modules.

{code}
>>> atlas-run-standalone --server localhost --product jira
...
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] Tomcat 7.x started on port [2990]
[INFO] jira started successfully in 73s at http://localhost:2990/jira
[INFO] Type Ctrl-D to shutdown gracefully
[INFO] Type Ctrl-C to exit
{code}

Then, from another terminal:
{code}
>>> netstat -anutp |grep LISTEN
...
tcp6    0    0 :::8009     :::*     LISTEN      32222/java
tcp6    0    0 :::2990     :::*     LISTEN      32222/java
tcp6    0    0 :::35730    :::*     LISTEN      32222/java
{code}

None of these sockets should, at this point, be bound to all interfaces.

Furthermore, users on other hosts can, at this point, connect to the listening instance using the default admin/admin credentials.

Many users do not know how to; do not know that they need to; or do not have permission to restrict access to these ports using firewall rules.
fields.summary: development standalone server should bind to localhost

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37627].
  {panel}

Previous issue JRA-19321 was closed without resolution, but numerous questions in answers.atlasian.com point to this being a common need.

Oddly *I get exactly what I want from JIRA started by the SDK* (v6.2.1#6256-sha1:f72b283), just not running instances.

see 
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/276206/issue-missing-from-relevantparams-in-customfield-validate
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/239068/how-to-get-current-project-and-issuetype-in-method-validatefromparams-method-in-my-customfield-plugin?page=1#276220
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/58011/custom-field-validation-how-to-get-an-issue-instance


h4. SDK provides Issue in relevantParams
{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  Keys for 'relevantParams'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: null
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: issue
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: requireProjectIds
{noformat}

h4. Standalone JIRA does not

{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  Keys for 'relevantParams'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]  ====================KEY: null
{noformat}
---


A custom field may be sensitive to the project context of the issue currently being validated. For instance I would like to get the list a actors associated with a project role of the project referenced by the issue being validated. The CustomFieldType interface method "public void validateFromParams(CustomFieldParams relevantParams, ErrorCollection errorCollectionToAddTo, FieldConfig config)" does not pass the Issue reference so I can't determine the projectId. I have tried different hacks to get access to the current issue (i.e. getting the "EditIssue" action from the Action context. The problem here is that if you edit another issue in another browser tab of the same browser, the second issue will overwrite the "Edit Issue" Action before the first Issue is validated.
If system field types get an Issue reference in the validation method why don't custom field types.
fields.summary: Request reference to the Issue object in the CustomFieldType interface method validateFromParams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37602].
  {panel}

As of JIRA 6.1, the Java API was modified to deprecate the [AttachmentUtils|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/util/AttachmentUtils.html] class, replacing it with the [AttachmentManager|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/AttachmentManager.html] service.  However, the file-handling methods of AttachmentUtils have been moved to the new [AttachmentStore|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/attachment/AttachmentStore.html] service, which is not exported for use by v2 plugins.

This means that any plugin attempting to access the actual Attachment files (e.g. copying them to another issue) must be implemented as a v1 plugin, which is often [less desirable|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Differences+between+Plugins1+and+Plugins2].

Please update the implementation to export the AttachmentStore service for use by v2 plugins.

(Note: I'm aware that v2 plugins can create their own instance of [DefaultAttachmentStore|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/6.1/com/atlassian/jira/issue/attachment/DefaultAttachmentStore.html], and this can be a short-term workaround.  However, this is not feasible for long-term maintainability, as it requires re-evaluating the implementation specifics with every new release.)
fields.summary: Provide AttachmentStore service to v2 plugins

fields.description:
As I jump on the Jira website the following message is shown,

"There is a problem with this website's security certificate. 
 
   
 The security certificate presented by this website has expired or is not yet valid.

Security certificate problems may indicate an attempt to fool you or intercept any data you send to the server.  
  We recommend that you close this webpage and do not continue to this website.  
  Click here to close this webpage.  
  Continue to this website (not recommended)."  

Ever since I received this message, the Attach a Screen Shot functionality in Jira does not work.  I have colleagues here at Wells Fargo who have the same issue.  And I've worked with our help desk and it isn't a Java version related issue.  Please let me know what we can do to resolve this defect.  

Thanks,

Michael Kort

fields.description:
We run Jira 6.2.1 and FishEye/Crucible 3.3.1.

We cannot see the source tab for Jira issues.

I DID NOT ultimately follow the instructions here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+authentication+for+an+application+link

Instead of "Trusted application links" that the above document suggests, I used OAuth authentication which I read elsewhere is required to see the new Development pane on the right-hand side. This panel now shows up.

After clicking OAuth two-way authentication on and off 3-4 times I finally got both sides, FishEye and Jira, to talk to each other.

The "Source" pane in "Activity" showed up.

Two issues that may or may not be related to this problem. First, when a colleague clicked on an item in the "Development" pane towards the bottom at the right, he was required to authenticate himself on the FishEye/Crucible server. This in spite of the fact that it is the Jira instance that handles usernames and passwords. This must clearly be a bug.

Secondly, 2-3 minutes later when I got back to my desk to triumphantly write an email to state that it worked, the "Source" pane was gone.

On the FishEye/Crucible server under "Application Links" in the first pane that comes up, every time it is opened, "Trusted application links", one could see one quarter of an error screen. This error screen requested that I give my credentials for loggin into the Jira server. I did so, but the source pane remains gone.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37589].
  {panel}

Hi,

We need to figure out the way to make edit-ability of JIRA fields based on field as well as tab under view/edit screen.

Currently we are facing the problem of inline editing,as after making a field read-only through behavioral plugin even then through inline editing in JIRA the very field can be edited.So we need the way to disable this inline editing.
We don't want to implement based on permission schema (Work around)
Can this be limited to specific tabs/fields under View screen?

Also we need to make certain fields in-editable for select users in select stages and the some of them editable for others (including the same rights even if one is trying to make use of inline editing,i.e. in-line edit-ability of fields to be based on user to user)


Also we need to make certain fields editable up-to certain stage (For selected users) and after that that fields becomes in-editable for rest stages (including closed stage),alone with edit-ability constraint satisfies in-line editing.i.e. if a field is marked to be in-editable then the very field should also be in-editable through inline editing as well.

Also can we tap the activities of users (say last login) and allowing only one person to login at a time

With Regards,
Abhishek Sharma.
fields.summary: Inline editing as per user privileges (Tab-wise and user wise) and non-editable based of editable fields stage and agent wise

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When JIRA Agile's ranking is broken, the {{com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:details-module}} does not render.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Break JIRA Agile ranking (unsure how to do this easily!).
# View an issue that has been ranked.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA displays the issue panel.

h3. Actual Results

The panel does not display as per the attached screenshot and an exception appears in the logs as below:

{noformat}
2014-03-20 16:59:43,399 http-apr-8080-exec-20 ERROR pt100945 1019x11765x2 ew1xyx 10.152.164.34,127.0.0.1 /browse/PONY-49 [jira.web.component.ModuleWebComponentImpl] Error rendering web panel: com.atlassian.jira.jira-view-issue-plugin:details-module (null)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankException: Multiple heads found in rank chain: issueIDs [[634166 r0 no prev n634164], [631373 r0 no prev n631375]] have no parent link. Please update the rank table and ensure that there is exactly one issue that has no child and exactly one that has no parent.
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexBuilder.validate(RankIndexBuilder.java:166)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexBuilder.build(RankIndexBuilder.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexServiceImpl$RankIndexSupplier.get(RankIndexServiceImpl.java:417)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexServiceImpl$RankIndexSupplier.get(RankIndexServiceImpl.java:388)

	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexServiceImpl.getIndex(RankIndexServiceImpl.java:385)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexServiceImpl.fetchCreate(RankIndexServiceImpl.java:348)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rank.RankIndexServiceImpl.getIssuePosition(RankIndexServiceImpl.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.rank.RankCFType.getValueFromIssue(RankCFType.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.getValue(CustomFieldImpl.java:384)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Follow the steps recommended in the following articles:
* [Error occurs on detail-module under issue view page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Error+occurs+on+detail-module+under+issue+view+page]
* [JIRA Agile Operations fail due to Sanity check for setting nextId of issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/JIRA+Agile+Operations+fail+due+to+Sanity+check+for+setting+nextId+of+issue]
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Details panel breaks when JIRA Agile ranking is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37581].
  {panel}

In our instance of Jira we are using the security level field as the basis of our security scheme and we are able to control who sees security issues at various levels.

However, when a reporter creates a security issue, the summary and description of the issue are passed back to the reporter and potential watchers in a clear text email. Subsequent changes to the issue are also reported in emails. A diligent attacker could monitor such emails.

It would be good if there was a simple way to control the content of emails sent when the security level is set.

Our current workaround is to use an alternate notification system that allows greater control, but a simpler built-in solution would benefit all users.
fields.summary: Jira sends clear text emails with details even when an issue has a non-public issue security scheme

This exception is only thrown when JIRA's database connection pool exhibits a significant failure, such as timing out. This should be fixed as per [JIRA Stops Functioning due to Timeout waiting for idle object|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Stops+Functioning+due+to+Timeout+waiting+for+idle+object].

Performance regression in wiki renderer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Date on version screen is wrong when user has different timezone from server
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Set user's TZ to system default
 # Create a version
 # Set a release date 7 days out
 # Observe the release date on the non admin version list of a project  !Screen Shot 2014-03-20 at 3.03.26 PM.png!
 # Change user's timezone in their profile to be 1 hour back from server time
 # Observe the release date on the non admin version list of a project  !Screen Shot 2014-03-20 at 3.02.39 PM.png!

h3. Expected results:

The date remains consistent.
h3. Actual results:

Date is off by 1 day. Unless the TZ difference is enough to cause an actual shift in date, the date should remain accurate.
h3. Workaround:
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes
This issue appears to be environment (database) specific, this needs further verification.
fields.summary: Date on version screen is wrong when user has different timezone from server

fields.description:
In Jira 6.1.2, I added custom fields for Developer and Tester, which are user-picker fields.

I added javascript to the Description of these fields, so that they would be pre-populated with user who was performing a transition.

Upon upgrading to Jira 6.2, this javascript in the Description field is no longer executed, instead it is printed out as plain text for the user to see. Javascript in the description fields of other fields works fine without any problems.

As a workaround I have moved the javascript out of the Tester and Developer fields into other fields that show on the transition screens, but it would be nice if the Description field for the user-picker custom fields continued to execute javascript, just like all of the other fields do.
fields.summary: Jira 6.2 breaks javascript in description of user-picker fields
Always make Search For Issues return a blank result set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37574].
  {panel}

*Problem*
After fully restoring a fresh OnDemand backup into a fresh JIRA 6.2.1 instance, no user is able to log into the application.

*Expected results*
JIRA should allow all users to successfully log into the application

*Actual Results*
All users (including sysadmin) get a "You do not have a permission to log in. If you think this is incorrect, please contact your JIRA administrators." error message.
atlassian-jira.security.log displays the following
{noformat}
2014-03-20 13:46:56,834 http-bio-8080-exec-1 anonymous 826x106x1 1p3qqqo 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login The user 'sysadmin' is NOT AUTHORIZED to perform to login for this request
2014-03-20 13:46:56,834 http-bio-8080-exec-1 anonymous 826x106x1 1p3qqqo 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login login : 'sysadmin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
{noformat}
No error is logged into catalina.out (or atlassian.jira.log).

Everything seems correct in the database side (cwd_user/app_user/cwd_membership/cwd_directory tables)

*Workaround*
- Import OnDemand backup using JIRA 6.2
- Shutdown the instance
